page.title: 07Social Concerns (1)
page.content:
The fear of nuclear war is constant but usually unvoiced. Most days aircraft from the nearby USAF and RAF airfields fly overhead, a constant reminder of an uncertain future.
Reduction in government support for local authorities puts pressure on the rates for domestic and commercial premises, and highway maintenance and education suffer (see Education). Imminent rate increases of up to 30% will affect most people in this area.
Continuing high rates of unemployment in the country generally are less of a problem in this area with its small population.
The safety of children on roads used by heavy farm traffic and weekend visitors causes concern.
